meta.title: Spacing
meta.description: Spacing tokens are used to define the space between elements.

mdx:
# Spacing Tokens Spacing tokens are used to define the space between elements. They are used to create consistent spacing between elements and to ensure that the layout is visually balanced. > [!NOTE] > Every token has a negative equivalent, in case you need to apply a negative > margin etc. Access the negative version by prependind the token name with a > dash. e.g. `-100`, `-400`, `-1000`, etc.

> [!TIP] > To quickly calculate the token value in px, take the token name and divide it > by 25. e.g. `100 / 25 = 4px`, `400 / 25 = 16px`, `1000 / 25 = 40px`, etc.

overview.mdx:
# Spacing Tokens Spacing tokens are used to define the space between elements. They are used to create consistent spacing between elements and to ensure that the layout is visually balanced. > [!NOTE] > Every token has a negative equivalent, in case you need to apply a negative > margin etc. Access the negative version by prependind the token name with a > dash. e.g. `-100`, `-400`, `-1000`, etc.

> [!TIP] > To quickly calculate the token value in px, take the token name and divide it > by 25. e.g. `100 / 25 = 4px`, `400 / 25 = 16px`, `1000 / 25 = 40px`, etc.
